declarations.description:
A web component to enable users to sort table data by clicking on column headers. Built with accessibility in mind, featuring keyboard navigation, screen reader announcements, and light DOM manipulation.

Based on the original jquery.easy-sortable-tables.js by Aaron Gustafson.
declarations.name: TableSortableElement

slots.description: The table element to make sortable. Should contain a table with thead (containing th elements) and tbody elements. The component will automatically inject buttons into th elements if none are present (progressive enhancement).

events.name: table-sortable:sort
events.description: Fired when a column is sorted

attributes.name: label-sortable
attributes.description: Custom label for sortable columns (default: 'Click to sort'). Used in screen reader announcements.

attributes.name: label-ascending
attributes.description: Custom label for ascending sort state (default: 'sorted ascending. Click to sort descending'). Used in screen reader announcements.

attributes.name: label-descending
attributes.description: Custom label for descending sort state (default: 'sorted descending. Click to sort ascending'). Used in screen reader announcements.

attributes.name: data-sort-value
attributes.description: Custom sort value for a table cell (td). When present, this value is used for sorting instead of the cell's text content. Useful for sorting by hidden values (e.g., timestamps, product codes) or numeric values with formatting.

attributes.name: data-sort-as
attributes.description: Marks an element within a table cell as containing the sort value. The text content of this element will be used for sorting. Typically used on a hidden span element to sort by last name while displaying 'First Last'.

attributes.name: data-table-sort-group
attributes.description: Groups table rows together during sorting. Rows with the same data-table-sort-group value will be kept together in their own tbody element. Use on tr elements within tbody groups to maintain logical groupings (e.g., departments, categories) while sorting within each group.

cssProperties.name: --table-sortable-indicator-asc
cssProperties.description: Ascending sort indicator character or symbol (default: ↑)

cssProperties.name: --table-sortable-indicator-desc
cssProperties.description: Descending sort indicator character or symbol (default: ↓)
